api package¶

Submodules¶

api.helper module¶

api.helper.bin_to_int(x)¶

Convert from a 32-bit binary string to a integer :type x: str :param x: 32-bit binary string :rtype: int :return: corresponding integer

api.helper.bitstring_to_bytes(s)¶
Return type

bytes

api.helper.concat_keys(key_array, size_of_key)¶

Helper function to concatenate keys. :param key_array: array of keys in decimal (int) form :param size_of_key: how many keys to concatenate together (eg. if 64bit, then size_of_key=2) :return: Array of concatenated keys in int type.

api.helper.concat_two_int(x, y)¶

Concatenate two integers in their 32-bit binary form.

For example: 123 in 32-bit binary is 00000000000000000000000001111011. 456 in 32-bit binary is 00000000000000000000000111001000. The binary concatenated form is 0000000000000000000000000111101100000000000000000000000111001000, which in base 10 is 528280977864. :type x: int :param x: base 10 integer :type y: int :param y: base 10 integer :rtype: int :return: concatenated integers in base 10

api.helper.int_to_base64(x)¶

Converts an integer to base64 string :type x: int :param x: integer to convert to base 64 :rtype: str :return: corresponding string in base64

api.helper.int_to_bitstring(x)¶

Convert an integer to AT LEAST a 32-bit binary string (pad extra bits with 0). If the integer is greater than 32-bits, then return the binary representation with the minimum number of bits to represent the integer. :type x: int :param x: integer :rtype: str :return: bitstring of AT LEAST 32-bit

api.helper.retrieve_keys_from_file(num_of_keys_to_retrieve, key_file_path)¶

Helper function to retrieve keys from the actual qcrypto binary key files. :type key_file_path: str :param key_file_path: :type num_of_keys_to_retrieve: int :param num_of_keys_to_retrieve: total number of keys to retrieve :return: array of keys in decimal (int) form.

api.kme module¶

class api.kme.KME(key_file_path)¶

Bases: object

Class for the KME on each node. This class also defines the related methods for manipulating the keys.

Parameters

key_file_path (str) – Relative file path to the directory storing qcrypto key files.

get_key(number, size)¶

Master function that returns the key container of keys from KME.

Parameters

  • number (str) – The number of keys requested.

  • size (str) – The size of each key in bits.

Returns

Key container containing the keys requested.

Return type

dict

get_key_with_id(key_ids)¶

Returns the key container of keys from KME given the key IDs.

Function will be called by the ‘slave’ application requesting for keys.

Parameters

key_ids (str) – Array of dictionaries containing the key ids. Each dictionary contains one key id, in the format: { “key_id”: <key_id> }

Returns

Key container containing the keys requested.

Return type

dict

get_multiple_keys(number, size)¶

Helper function that calculates the logic of how many keys is needed.

Parameters

  • number – number of keys requested

  • size – size of each key in bits

Returns

dictionary, where key and values are tuples with the key IDs and keys

get_status()¶

Returns status of KME according to the ETSI specification.

Returns

Dictionary containing status properties of KME.

Return type

dict

key_size = 32¶
master_SAE_ID = '10.0.1.10'¶
max_SAE_ID_count = 0¶
max_key_per_request = 10¶
max_key_size = 1024¶
min_key_size = 32¶
slave_SAE_ID = '10.0.1.20'¶
source_KME_ID = '10.0.1.30'¶

IP address of the source (master) KME.

status_extension = ''¶
target_KME_ID = '10.0.1.40'¶

IP address of the target (slave) KME.
